conclusion: Analyze the graph and use the relationship between velocity, acceleration, and displacement.
The graph shows v^2 on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
Equation for uniformly accelerated motion: v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
Rearrange the equation to express it in terms of v^2.
The graph shows (v^2)/2 plotted against x.
The slope of the line in this graph represents the coefficient a.
The slope of the line for Car A is steeper than the slope of the line for Car B.
A steeper slope indicates a larger value of a.
Since the slope of the line for Car A is greater than for Car B, Car A has a greater acceleration.
